results.title: The Enchanted miller
results.creator_credit: Josef Vacha, Czechoslovak State Film and Official Films
results.brief_description: A cartoon version of a folk tale. A water demon has enchanted a mill and put its workers to flight. He torments them and continually evades their clutches by changing his shape. Finally they catch him and cut off his coat tails, thus depriving him of his magic powers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Josef Vacha, Czechoslovak State Film and Official Films

results.title: Encaustic by Karl Zerbe
results.brief_description: This film explains that encaustic - hot wax used as a binder for pigment - is an ancient painting technique revised by Karl Zerbe in the late 1930’s. Follows the artist in the various steps from the laying of a collage ground on bare masonite through the final touches of blowtorch to the surface of the finished painting.

results.title: Enameling art
results.creator_credit: Robert Longini and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Indicates the basic practices common to this medium. Shows students at work enamelling on copper, with close-ups to demonstrate specific techniques.

results.title: En Normandie
results.brief_description: One of a series of teaching films with commentary in simple French. Illustrates the farm life of the province and then by contrast shows the industrial life concluding with several views of the two large ports, Rouen and Le Havre.

results.title: The Empty seas
results.creator_credit: Henri Fabiani, James Carr and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Camaret, on the coast of Brittany, relies on lobster fishing and boat building for its livelihood. However, some areas are being fished out and the industry is dying. Shows the continued, and often unrewarded, toil of the men on one of the lobster boats, whose search extends as far as South America and Mauritania.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henri Fabiani, James Carr and World Wide Pictures

results.title: The Empty quarter
results.creator_credit: Richard Taylor, Mostafa Hammuri and I T T Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the expedition of the Englishman, Wilfred Patrick Thesiger, through the desert of South Arabia, the home of the Bedouin. Provides an intimate insight into the life and customs of the inhabitants of the ‘Empty Quarter’ of Arabia

results.title: The Empty hand
results.brief_description: Karate means “empty hand” in Japanese. Filmed at a Karate school in New York, “black belt” experts demonstrate the Japanese art of defending oneself without use of weapons by striking an attacker with the hands, elbows, knees or feet. Winner of a Cine Golden Eagle and nine other international festival awards.

results.title: The Empty frame
results.brief_description: The biography of Robert Goddard and the history of the development of rocketry. Shows how Goddard’s research and developmental work, with respect to rocketry, made possible the great space exploration vehicles of today. Includes archival footage

results.title: The Emperor's oblong pancake. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Fine Arts and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: An animated version of the story by Peter Hughes about the emperor who tried to change all the round objects in his kingdom into oblong ones. Narrated by Edward Everett Horton. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
